reviews.title: Hard to beat a Ritz
reviews.text: This Ritz is very nice, on the opposite end of the island from town and airport. a ton of ammenities available for guests, sunset cruises, snorkling, etc. service is below a large city Ritz, but not bad.

reviews.title: YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR
reviews.text: So many of us want to get away from it all and want to do so by spending as little as we possibly can. I travel to St. Thomas regularly and my hotel choice over these past ten years has been the Ritz-Carlton. My first visit was about ten years ago. At that point I hadn't had a vacation for over seven years. So I thought I would splurge and treat myself to an indulgent stay at the Ritz Carlton. Since I've been traveling on my own, I thought I'd never spend tons of money on a hotel room. I thought it was a waste of my hard earned money. My thought process has always been "if the room is clean and comfortable, that's all that matters.". YOU SHOULDN'T HAVE TO TAKE OUT A SECOND MORTGAGE TO FIND ONE! I have tried and tried to open my mind by staying at other resorts on the island but nothing compares to the oppulance the Ritz Carlton provides, and this oppulance is not just limited to the voluptuous visuals throughout the resort. The accomodations are oppulant. The service is oppulant. Every guest is treated like kings and queens. I can't say enough about this resort. Don't skimp when it comes to your getaway. In the end you always get what you pay for. Afterall, you deserve it. You won't go wrong investing in the Ritz for your next vacation. The second mortgage is worth it!!

My husband and I just returned from a six night stay for our "belated" 25th wedding anniversary. All I can say is that is was absolutely fantastic. We stayed in the Begonia building and it was in very close proximity to everything from the food areas to the pool and the beach. The resort fee of $35 per day included all of the water activity sports among other things. It was well worth it if you spend a lot of your time there at the Ritz. You could paddleboat, windsurf, hobie cat, barracuda, snorkel, etc. The pool area, the beach and the surrounding grounds were beautiful and well maintained. What struck us the most was how polite and courteous and very helpful everyone was, from the grounds people to the conceirge desk. Everyone went out of their way to help you and "always" acknowledged you. We had the bed and breakfast package and the morning breakfast buffet was mouthwatering. I'm not much of a breakfast person but I actually looked forward to this each day!!! The view each morning was magnificent and the food was very good!! I miss that very much. Every evening at The Grille and the outdoor bar area there was a steel drum band playing live. We looked forward to enjoying them every evening after we returned from our evening stroll around the grounds. The prices for dinner are a bit pricey but there are other options. We had rented a car and were very glad that we did!! It takes a little getting used to (not much but a constant reminder from the wife to "stay left") but it was well worth it. We ate at "Off the Hook" in Red Hook and also at "Whale of a Tale" in Red Hook. Another great eating place is within walking distance from the Ritz. It's called "Robert's" and it is at the Elysian Resort which is next door. It was a very average place but the food was extremely good and service was also. Make sure you order dessert!!! Here are some neat ideas to do when you are there. We did the Reef Bay Trail Hike over on St. John Island. You must reserve this in advance. Check it out when staying at the Ritz. Also, take a trip to the British Virgin Islands if you can. We chartered a boat with no more than 12 people called "Pirate's Penny". It left Red Hook at about 7:45am and picked up another couple in St. John. Then we were on our way to a day of great fun. We traveled around Tortola and then stopped at Virgin Gorda. We snorkeled and also saw The Baths at Virgin Gorda. Then we ate lunch on Cooper Island and then stopped for more snorkeling at Norman Island. What a fabulous day we had. If you have never snorkeled (which I hadn't) please don't give up. Keep trying until you feel comfortable with it. It's well worth it seeing the beautiful world under the water. All in all, this was a wonderful trip and we would certainly go back to the Ritz. Very pampered and so much fun!!!
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic!
Beautiful relaxing vaca (with kids)
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ritz Feb 06 with our kids.

reviews.title: Top Notch
reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful. The grounds are lovely. The atmosphere was very relaxing. We spent four days in St Thomas after spending four days at the Ritz in San Juan (St Thomas was much more beautiful. San Jaun Ritz is just so convenient being 5 min from the airport. The flight to St Thomas from San Juan felt like 15 mins.) The service is exceptional (only slow if you are in a rush for something which you shouldnt be if you are on vacation... RELAX). The prices were exactly what you should expect from the Ritz and most of the food was good. If you book your vacations at the Ritz be prepared to pay for it and stop complaining about the prices. If you think you should pay less for a room, a cocktail, and a burger stay somewhere else and save the Ritzy space for the rest of us who are ready, willing, and able to pay up, sit back, and RELAX.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ritz Carlton's Club Level truly lives up to every expectation we had. First, the location,(after the 25 minute cab ride from the airport) delivered us to an uncomparable greeting in a beautiful setting. We were not asked to check in but our bags were put on an oversized golf cart where we were driven to our room. Once we gave Armondo our name, they were expecting us. Our bags were placed on the bench in front of our king size bed in our very nice sized room. We were on the end so our beautiful view was from our wrap-around balcony.
reviews.title: The Most Wonderful Hotel and Locale

reviews.text: We went to the club level where we were greeted by the concierge just for the club level. We were able to access the room any time, sit inside or out and were able to have a light breakfast daily, snacks, fresh fruit, lunch, waters, snacks at dinner time and late night desserts, with an open bar. The choices changed daily.
reviews.title: A Great Family Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge was extremely friendly and helpful, making any reservations for dinners both on and off property as well as excursions that we wanted. They also made outstanding recommendations.
reviews.title: Never again..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is located on the East end of the island so we had a beautifully clear view to St. John. The property is impeccably clean; all staff extremely courteous and friendly; all water sports personnel were extremely helpful...we can't say enough!
reviews.title: The perfect relaxing get-away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first place we want to return to; the hotel was top-notch, the locale beautiful; perfect time to visit - the week before school vacation; a little pricey but totally worth it!
reviews.title: Club lounge restaurant just is not Ritz style

reviews.text: Just returned from staying 4 nights at the Ritz after staying 3 nights at Caneel Bay in St. John and we loved it. The infinity pool that overlooks the ocean is awesome. Waiters coming around frequently with drink and food menus. Rafts to float around in the pool and ocean. The service was fantastic, every worker that walked past us stopped to say hi and see how we were doing. The ones that we saw a few times even remembered previous converstations, I was very impressed. The rooms were beautiful, housekeeping came in twice a day. The only negative aspect I could say is that the walls were pretty thin. We could hear the people above us as well as next to us at times and at Caneel Bay you couldn't hear a thing from above or next door. The food was great, pricy, but no matter where you go you are looking at about the same prices. Ritz is undergoing a major renovation and will be closed for a few months, I think starting in August, I am looking forward to going back to see how they are able to make it better than it is now.
reviews.title: Had a fantastic time

reviews.text: This has to be one of the worst Ritz Carlton's I have EVER gone to. The property is pretty, the beach is nice (although a bit shelly), and the rooms are decent. However the service is HORRIBLE and the food HORENDOUS. The people who work at this resort are rude and inconsiderate. They appear to hate their jobs and hate life in general. We had to make multiple requests for things & they forgot to officially book our spa appointments. I had to call three times to get someone to help me with my bags. No one ever showed up, so my husband had to go find someone. The rooms are pretty far from the main building and although they offer complimentary rides to the main building no one ever shows up to pick you up and if they do, they are extremely rude. The food was horrible in all the restaurants. I'm still wondering how this hotel could have a 5 star rating. This was the type of food and service I would expect from a Holiday Inn. Actually I have eaten better at Holiday Inn's.
reviews.title: Mediocre

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights over Memorial Day weekend. Having been to several other Ritz (and FS) properties, we found the Ritz St. Thomas mildly disappointing and not as nice as other Ritz properties.
reviews.title: Mildly Disappointing

reviews.text: The Property: We found that the pool and other common areas to be small for the number of guestrooms. The infinity pool area looks great, but fails in practicality. The pool is cramped, with chairs right on top of each other and the pool. Because the pool is situated at the bottom of the sloped property, sound carries from everywhere. As there is no kids pool or adults-only pool, depending on the season, one can expect a lot of kids in and around the pool. Noisy parents and noisy kids unfortunately ruled the pool during our visit. The beach chairs are similarly on top of each other, not lending themselves to privacy.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Ritz
Not up to Par, Needs a service adjustment!!
reviews.text: We also found the property to be tired and in need of renovation. There was unused restaurant equipment being stored along the paths from the pool/common areas to the building and other areas – unexpected and inappropriate for a 5-star resort like a Ritz.

My husband and I just came back from a much anticipated week long vacation at the Ritz in St. Thomas. We have stayed at many Ritz-Carlton properties and are huge fans of the Ritz, except for this one! I have many comments, so I will divide my comments into sections:
reviews.title: Ritz not so Ritzy!

reviews.text: 1. Taxis- Expensive! They charge per person and expect to share. I hated this. Most Taxis charge the same rate per person no matter how many other passengers are in the van! A short 10 minute drive for dinner would cost us $10 per person one way. I was truly enraged one evening when we were picked up and had already been on the road for about five minutes and the driver got a call and said that he was going to turn back around to pick up others from the same restaurant who were also heading back to the Ritz! We said no, we didnt want to share and reminded him that we had requested a "no sharing taxi". He seemed angry and when he dropped us off, my husband gave him the typical $20 dollar fare and he reminded us that we asked for a no sharing taxi and he wanted more! I think the name of this Taxi service is Willey's Taxi.
reviews.title: Great hotel -- worth the expense.
Best of St. Thomas
reviews.text: 2. Hotel- We were both truly disappointed by the Ritz-Carlton property. It is definitely not up to Ritz standards. Upon entering our room, the carpet was full of stains and they were still cleaning the room. You are supposed to get turn-down service everynight without requesting it and one night they didnt even bother to clean the room, they just plopped down a bunch of clean towels on the bathroom sink! We found this very insulting and complained. Another night the toilet wasnt working and we called the "engineer" who took about 2 hours to come fix it (which took 2 mins). On other nights, they forgot to put new shampoo, bath gel etc in our room. I willnot be staying at this property again!

reviews.title: Mixed Blessing
reviews.text: 3. Club Floor- We had access to the Club floor where there are five meal presentations per day. Once again the club floor was not up to ritz standards. The only two meal presentations that are were up to standards are the breakfast presentation with the made to order pancakes and omlettes and the afternoon cocktail presentation. The other Ritz properties I've stayed at had much better presentations and much more a selection. However, I must mention that the staff on the club floor are all very nice, probably the nicest people on st. thomas.

4. Club Floor Rules- One thing that really got to me was the fact that people did not follow the rules on the club floor. There is a dress code and while I am eating I did not appreciate seeing people in swimsuits or a robe and slippers. I know that it is no tolerated on the club floor in other Ritz-Carlton's. I realize that people want to be comfortable, but they should respect the rules and the people who follow the rules. Ladies- what is the purpose of the mesh cover-up? or the sheer cover-up? Anyway enough about that. I have more to complain about...
reviews.title: Awesome Vacation

reviews.text: My husband, mother, sibs and in-laws spent the first week of March at the Ritz. What a beautiful hotel with wonderful staff. We stayed in the club level which is well worth the extra money. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable for each of us. We enjoyed the club lounge each day for breakfast, light lunch and apps in the early evening. The staff in the club section of the hotel went above and beyond for their customers. Ruth (consiege) was one personable lady with great suggestions on where to venture out too for dinners. With a party of 7 she had no problems making reservations for us a couple of our nights.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent our days on the beach relaxing and enjoying the water, hobie cats, kayakes and such. The beach staff were also fantastic as were the bar and spa staff. Everyone who worked for the hotel always had a smile on their face and greeted you warmly.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only complaint I have about the island in general is that it is very expensive. There are some great restaurants to try but don't be sticker shocked on the prices. The Agave Terrace and The Old Stone Farm House were fantastic. Mim's Beachside Bistro was good (mostly outdoor seating) and so wasn't The Cellar. Expect to pay at least $10 per person for a taxi in the evening but the establishments are well worth the fare. We did eat at Bleuwater at the hotel one night. It was very elegant and delicious but on the pricey side as well.
reviews.title: A relaxing, wonderful stay....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chartered a yacht one day from http://www.motoryachtcinnamonbay.com/privatecharters.html. Donna and Dan were a fantastic couple who were very knowledgeable about the area. We snorkeled off of St. John in two seperate areas. The wooden yacht was comfortable and fun to be on. There is a lot of history behind the yacht itself. It's not your typical charter boat by any means!
reviews.title: Should be a Marriott, not a ritz

reviews.text: I have never written a review about a hotel, but for some reason felt obligated to write about this riz. I have stayed at a number of high end hotels one and only clubs, palms turks etc. This ritz is not worth the money, the service is pretty good, the rooms are pretty nice, the grounds are pretty well kept and the beach is decent. All that being said the rooms are 825 bucks a night all in and for that kind of money, everything should be real good, not pretty good....I love St Thomas, the island the people the location are all great, but the Ritz St. Thomas is just good and for that kind of money it too should be great. I would recommend the Marriott Frenchmen's Reef over this Ritz, especially if you are comparing dollars and cents.
reviews.title: A real vacation - great staff and facilities for families who like the beach

reviews.text: The virgin islands are great, we spent time in St John and we did a day trip to the various BVI. Definitely stay in St John if you can. We went on an awesome trip with new Horizons II to the BVI, so amazing!
reviews.title: Not a fan of the Ritz St Thomas

reviews.text: As for the hotel, I must say I wasn’t super impressed. I mean for me, staying on points its fine, but if I were paying $700 a night I think I would be sad. But I did save my Marriott points for 5 years (250,000 points) so I guess that means something too.
reviews.title: Laid Back Luxury

reviews.text: The resort is very pretty, and the pools are nice, and the location on the island was really the best. The other end of the island is very crazed with the cruise ships so it was nice being separate from that. Its right near the area called Red Hook which is where the ferry to St John is.
reviews.title: Fairy Tale Wedding at the Ritz St.Thomas
Worth every penny (and it costs lots of them)!
reviews.text: There are a handful of good restaurants and good bars nearby so that was very easy. We really liked Off the Hook and Duffys Love Shack. We went to Agave Terrace, and that was pretty good, nothing amazing. We went to 2 places in Charlotte Amalie - The Green House and Room with A View. The Green House was very average and definitely not worth the $40 roundtrip cabride. Room With A View was very good, and also very pretty even though we were there on a rainy night.

The hotel was chock full of kids. This was my own fault for not realizing it was easter week. But it would have been nice if there had been an adult area at the beach, or an adult pool. We never could get in the pool b/c the kids filled it up with millions of floating rafts. The Beach area was pretty small, and all of the chairs were very close together so you had to sit right on top of other people. Also they don’t pull the chair cushions at night so when it rained you had to sit on wet chairs all day.
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.text: We spent two delightful weeks at the Ritz residences. A change in management has been positively recieved, from the warm greeting upon arrival to ease of departure and everything in between. All the reataurants on property are fabulous. New menu at Coconut Cove has some great salads and perfect service with the best view in the islands. Be sure to try the outdoor lobster/steak/fish grilling. Bluewater is fabulous food, pricey but worth it. Great Bay lounge is very relaxing and excellent food but the menu is a little stale....sushi is fantastic. The ladies and gentlemen of the Ritz staff are surely dedicated to the comfort of your stay.
reviews.title: Very relaxing

reviews.text: We have stayed on a couple of different hotels on St Thomas. The Ritz is clearly the best. The hotel is very nice with great views. The beach is very good. The staff was friendly and helpful. We went on a day trip on their sailboat to St John and Jost Van Dyke. This was the best part of our trip. Make sure you plan an outing on their boat if you go. The location is good, near Red Hook were there are several places to eat.
reviews.title: Best on St. Thomas

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel because of our travel agent's recommendation, our positive previous experiences at Ritz resorts, and it was a convenient place for us to travel. We were extremely impressed with the resort and had a fantastic time. In contrast to prior reviews on this site,we actually found the hospitality to be excellent. Staff were extremely friendly and went out of their way to help us. There were a lot of activities for the kids, including snorkeling, sailing, kayaking, and paddle boating. There are 2 pools, one of which is heated, which was great. We were able to eat outdoors for all meals. Food was very good but extremely expensive so be prepared to add a lot of cost to the trip. We did take a taxi to a nearby grocery store and purchased breakfast and lunch food for several days so that decreased the cost. We didn't feel a need to leave the resort and had plenty to do for 6 nights/7 days. BTW, the watercolor class is a must!
reviews.title: A typical Ritz resort--great for kids!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Club Level from December 8 - 14 and loved every minute. When we arrived we were taken to the Club check in and everything went smoothly until we left. The property is beautiful with a beach that has two marvelous snorkeling spots. We used all the included water equipment such as flippers, glass bottom sea kayaks, and pedal boats. We also enjoyed the towel and beach chair service on the beach as well as the pool.
reviews.title: Take Me Back

reviews.text: Because we live in the intermountain west we've been going to Hawaii more frequently. We love Hawaii for the whales (in winter) and because it is easy to rent a car and drive everywhere. Hawaii also has great hiking. That said, the temperature of the water for snorkeling in the Caribbean is unbeatable. We did not rent a car on St Thomas and never regretted that decision as the roads are narrow and left-side driving disorienting. Because of the all-inclusive nature of the Ritz we could be active there and then took a taxi to a mangrove sea kayak expedition and to Red Hook for the St John ferry.
reviews.title: The best vacation ever

reviews.text: Booked a five night stay for our 25th anniversary. Decided on a club suite ($635 per night) in the Gardenia building (contains 12 rooms and 12 suites) so that we could enjoy the fabulous club food service. Upon arrival we were told that we would be in a club room ($535 per night), not a club suite, and no club suites would be available during our stay. I should mention that a suite is twice the size of a room. We had booked through RC central reservations and had proof of our suite reservation (and, by the way, we had paid a deposit for a suite for three of the five nights!). The manager was not on the premises so the concierge of the club room handled the situation. A nice guy but not prepared to handle this situation. I was ready to hop over to Caneel but my husband negotiated a significant deduction in the price of the club room--$335 per night. That was a fair deal but very disappointing from a Ritz Carlton when celebrating your 25th anniversary. I have no proof of this but I think they overbooked the club accommodations and put us in a room because there were only two of us. I noticed that everyone walking out of a suite was a family of three or four. Having said that, our stay was quite nice. The room was fine (equivalent to our club room at the Four Seasons Maui). Grounds and pool were lovely. The view is unbelievable. We did not eat on property (other than the club room which was excellent and plentiful). We ate at Havana Blue, Old Stone Farmhouse, Off the Hook, Agave Terrace and ZoZo's in St. John. None of these were inexpensive and all involved a hefty cab fare. The food was good (7 out of 10) but views were outstanding. At checkout, we had a $134 credit due to our suite deposit so that was nice. Despite our disappointment, we would return but I suggest you call the hotel directly a few days before your arrival to reconfirm your reservation.
reviews.title: Quite nice but a slow start...
Remarkable yet disappointing
reviews.text: P.S. Gardenia building is closing in October to be turned into an RC residence. Club accommodations will move to an existing building on the hotel side of the property. There may be a few months this winter when club accommodations will not be available.

Upon arrival, we found the RC to be breath-taking. It was our honeymoon and we arrived tired and ready to relax. What we found was a wonderful place to do exactly that. The check-in was easy and quick and before we knew it we were headed to our room. (The rum punch certainly jump-started us on a long relaxed week.)
reviews.title: Hot Hot Hot...in so many ways
Minor adjustments to address
reviews.text: The room was georgeous with a large bathroom, comfortable bed and soothingly cool marble tile on the floor. But ocean called to us and we walked out to the deck to enjoy the view. The RC has a lovely beach and a nice view of St. John. The aquamarine water was just splendid and the warm breeze quickly scattered the remaining stress of the wedding.

reviews.title: Enjoyed the Ritz
reviews.text: We stayed for a full week and had a fantastic vacation, one we will certainly treasure forever and in truth the RC was a lot of the reason. The grounds were beautiful, the room was just phenomenal, and the staff was so friendly and helpful they quickly felt like family.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mt husband and I returned last night from St Thomas where we stayed at the Ritz Carlton Hotel. We had a great time and we can't give eneuogh accolades to the staff that works there. We found everyone very helpful and informative on all of our questions. If someone wasn't able to answer a question, they searched the entire staff until they had an answer for us.
reviews.title: If the Ritz could tuck you in and tell you a bedtime story, they would!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only complaint was that in their website they should mention the amount of walking and stairs that you have to do in order to get to your room, lobby, pool and beach. If you're not in the best of shape this can become quiete bothersome. But despite that, averything else was perfect. We intend on taking our family of 7 to the Ritz Carlton in Jamaica in a few months. We are hoping that our family enjoys this hotel as much as we did in St Thomas.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay in Paradise!

reviews.text: Traveled to this beautiful island 1-23-11 for one week. Can't say enough great things about this resort. We were greeted at the hotel with a warm hand towel, a tropical drink and a shot of pineapple rum. Yum! The staff was very friendly and the service was outstanding. The food was delicious in the restaurants and the weather was perfect all week. Take the sunset cruise on the Lady Lindsey. Also loved the 10 hour boating adventure to Virgin Gorda, British Virgin Islands, the Baths, etc. Swim to the Soggy Dollar Beach, a remote beach in the BVI that you have to swim to because boats can't dock, and pay for your drinks with your soggy dollars. Snorkling and lunch on the beach are included in this trip too. Had a blast! Need your passport for this one. Only negative is it takes some time to get all the passengers signed in (45 minutes) and you have to stop in customs on the way back (this took at the most 15 minutes for us). Did go down to Redhook one night and had a wonderful dinner at the Italian restaurant there. Portions are large and you could really split one entree. If you want to splurge and have a relaxing getaway and some fun too, I would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Hotel, rooms were big and clean. Very friendly staff, restaurants (sush and blue water) had excellent food, it's not cheap to stay here - but worth it. Nice to sit on the beach and have a waiter bring you a pina colada, and they have excellent fish tacos (they will bring you any food you want on the beach). Infinity pool was great, as was the hot tub.
reviews.title: Beautiful stay

reviews.text: Went sailing on the RC's 'lady lynsey', it was awesome - snorkeling and great food and drink - and very friendly crew - Captain Doug was great. There were only 4 of us on the trip (10-2 on a monday) - so it felt like a private sail.
reviews.title: Great stay!!

reviews.text: Me and my family stayed at the Ritz from 8/27/05 to 9/1/05. This was our second visit to the resort. (First time in 2002) Since it is the slow season, we had the entire resort to ourselves and loved it!! We booked a double room in the club level side and received an upgrade to an executive suite at check-in. The room was great, had a pull out sofa for my children and a king size bed for me and my wife. The suite also had one and half baths, nice for a family of four. The service on the club floor was ok ( Malcom was the best!) but not as good as others we stayed in ( Cancun, San Juan, Montego bay) . We knew from the last time we visited the resort that the service is just average, but everything else makes up for it. The food on the club level was great for breakfast and lunch, ok in the evening. We went to Off the Hook in town one night for dinner, the food was great. We will visit this resort again in the future. This is the best resort in St. thomas no doubt about it. The view, ocean and complete layout of this resort is like no other. Also- Trunk Bay on St.johns was a great day trip, water was awesome and warm, but I have to say the beach and water at the Ritz was just as good! Arrange airport transfers with Ritz (Private SUV) WORTH IT!
reviews.title: The Ritz was paradise!
Amazing...
reviews.text: What can I say??
You can't go wrong with Ritz Carlton.
reviews.title: not great ,but the best you can get

reviews.text: My husband and I went to St. Thomas for our little trip in August 2005. It was absolutely amazing... We still keep talking about it and dreaming about the next time we put our feet in this warm, unbelievably clear, blue water.
reviews.title: Very attentive staff, ok room.

reviews.text: Ritz is definitely THE place to stay in St. Thomas. Warm welcome by the staff included punch with double rum, by request. Staff was extremaly friendly and always ready to offer their help.
reviews.title: Not What We Expected From a Ritz-Carlton
Not worth the price
reviews.text: Recently spent my honeymoon in the St. Thomas Ritz. The hotel is beautiful but the service is awful. All of our package details were wrong, our bill was incorrect, our airport transfers were late or did not show at all, and the food is average at best. Finally, when i asked to speak to someone about my displeasure i was told she was in a meeting and i would have to wait. I waited for 45 minutes until my transportation finally arrived and left without talking to anyone.

This is NOT $900 a night service. If you want to go to STT, stay at the Westin (in St. John) and get what you expect, average hotel and average service. Atleast you won't feel like you have been taken advantage of.
reviews.title: Nice Long Weekend....

reviews.text: My husband and I went to the Ritz Carlton in St. Thomas for a long weekend -- Jan 18-22nd. It was an easy flight from JFK to St. Thomas. We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Club which is located right next to the hotel. My husband's boss has a 3-bedroom place at the Club and we didn't have to pay for it. We were with two other couples. I'm not sure how these rooms compare with the hotel rooms, but this place was beautiful. Comfy beds, granite kitchen, marble bathrooms, etc. We spent a lot of time on the grounds of the Club as well as the actual hotel. You really just feel like it's one big resort. The grounds are beautiful. There was some construction going on by the Club... but it didn't disturb us at all. Everything is well manicured and clean. There are two beaches. Both were clean and the water, although a bit rough, was nice and warm. The beaches are on the small side... but very pretty. The pools were great as well. We ate most of our meals at the resort... and all of the food was extremely good. They also have great "islandy" umbrella drinks. I will say that the prices were steep ($10.25 for a fruity drink).. but that's to be expected at a Ritz Carlton. What stood out most to me was the friendliness of the staff. They were all so nice and helpful and went out of their way to help you. I found this to be very impressive. We left the resort 2x to head into Red Hook. Had a good dinner at a place called Off the Hook.. very casual but my meal was tasty. We also ate at Duffy's Love Shack... funny place... a shack right in the middle of a parking lot! It was fun... but the food wasn't that great. It's not the type of place that you probably go to for the food though! I was last in St. Thomas 8 years ago... and ate at many good restaurants (Agave Terrace and Craig and Sally's were my favorites). We were just too lazy to leave the resort this time!
reviews.title: Fantastic!!!

reviews.text: My overall thoughts:
reviews.title: Nicer than Expected
Low Key Luxury
reviews.text: I thoroughly enjoyed myself. The resort is very nice. However, if I were paying for the room, I'd problem go somewhere else. I can imagine that the rates are steep. The reason I probably wouldn't return (unless of course, I got to stay for free) is because I really don't like the island of St. Thomas. It's too commercialized for me... we were stuck in traffic to/from the airport. The beach was beautiful but I've been to nicer ones-- Bahamas, Anguilla, etc. Overall though, I did love this place.

We just returned from the Ritz Carlton. The resort is absolutely beautiful. We stayed in the Gardenia Building on the third floor in a suite. The room had a huge balcony with wonderful views on Great Bay and St John. This room had access to the Club Room which we took advantage of most mornings for breakfast. Good selection of breakfast foods. . . from fruits, pastries, cereals, omelets, etc. Our room was beautifully appointed and everything was clean and in great condition. The bed was very comfy. The bathroom was well stocked with all the essentials.
reviews.title: Perfect Vacation Resort!

reviews.text: My only minor complaints are the shower water was not as hot as I would normally like, the room service menu could be better and more expansive, the wireless internet service is spotty at best--it only worked in one spot in our room not to mention you have to pay $25 a day for access, and the carpet in our room had a few stains.
reviews.title: Best place on the island!!

reviews.text: But back to the good stuff. The grounds are nicely maintained and gorgeous. The architecture is interesting and pleasing to the eye. The pools are very clean. The staff is superb, helpful, and attentive. I really cannot say enough good things about this resort. You will pay more than elsewhere on the island for this luxury but it is your vacation--go for it. It is worth the money.
reviews.title: For St. Thomas, the best place to stay....

reviews.text: We stayed at the Ritz the last week of May and the hotel and lush grounds are beautiful. I agree with the previous comments - the Ritz is the best place to stay on the island if you are accustomed to top quality accommodations. Sure, there are things that could be improved upon and for the price of a per night stay there should be nothing to improve upon. But, when you stop to think of the normal grind at home versus the beauty of the hotel the items needing improved don’t seem all that major. The surrounding areas are less than appealing and the drive seems a little intimidating but after a few trips in and out of the hotel you get used to the views or lack of.... Items requiring improvement: (1) Service at the restaurants - the Palm Garden Cafe in particular -- it took Walter 26 minutes to bring two cups of coffee and dessert. The cafe was not crowded and the order was painfully simple but alas this is the islands and we are on vacation.... (2) Broken tiles in the villa area -- I know this sounds petty but as we walked up the stairs to our room daily I could not help but notice the missing/cracked tiles on the stairwell. Again, this may be petty but the Ritz is known for the utmost perfection in all aspects. (3) The cleaning staff needs to be more thorough (the rooms were very CLEAN - please don't misinterpret) just little issues like sweeping the floors better - replacing a robe .... Now for the good stuff -- the positives: (1) The hotel and grounds are beautiful - the views are just gorgeous!! (2) The resort fee is fabulous - for the $35/day you have unlimited use of the "toys" on the beach - and they have several items (i.e. not just one kayak, or one windsurfing board....) and the gang that operates this area is quick to respond to any need you may have. (3) The beaches are beautiful and have just been equipped with new chairs. The towel staff is quick to respond to your needs and will move chairs and umbrellas anywhere to satisfy you. (4) The Lady Lyndsey is great for sailing and snorkeling. Again Capt. Mickey and his crew could not be more accommodating. All you need to do is sit back relax and enjoy the view. I would highly recommend this activity. My husband and I ate at every venue at the resort. All were good not great just good - but oh so convenient!! The service seems to be slow across the board but they do their best to make you happy. For instance, I read the reviews about the Great Bay Grill and the "Bright Lights/Cafeteria Style Lighting..." - all this is true - the lights were way too bright. So when he hostess came past I simply asked her to dim the lights which she did immediately and then came back to the table and asked if I was satisfied or should they be dimmed further? Where else are you going to get this service and respect? So for those of you who think the lights are too bright just asked for them to be lowered and your request will be quickly accommodated. All in all this was a very relaxing and enjoyable vacation for my husband and me. The resort is beautiful and the staff is most accommodated (I think I used this word a lot but it best describes the overall service). I hope this review helps and all of you have safe travels and an enjoyable holiday!
reviews.title: Ritz Carlton Club near perfect

reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from St. Thomas 5/25/05-5/31/05. The ride to the Ritz-Carlton from the airport is just awful. You ride through the slums of St. Thomas and to me that made me not want to leave the resort for anything. You may be OK to leave the resort, but we didn't want to take a chance. Of all the places to stay on the island the Ritz was it! It is much nicer than the Marriott, Wyndham, and any other place on the island. It is very expensive though. My wife and I had a buffet dinner there and our bill for two with a couple of drinks was $210. But any nice restaurant on the island is very expensive. The Ritz has by far the best beach I had seen on St. Thomas. It was gorgeous! They also have the best view.
reviews.title: Best of both Worlds!
